Sentencas: Ruddlesden-Popper La2NiO4+delta (LNO) oxygen electrodes were investigated under solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC) operation conditions.
Titulo: Performance and stability of Ruddlesden-Popper La2NiO4+δ oxygen electrodes under solid oxide electrolysis cell operation conditions

Sentencas: The electrochemical performance of LNO was measured in both solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) and SOEC modes at 750 degrees C in air.
Titulo: Performance and stability of Ruddlesden-Popper La2NiO4+δ oxygen electrodes under solid oxide electrolysis cell operation conditions

Sentencas: The results suggest that LNO oxygen electrodes exhibit high electrochemical activity and the processes related to oxygen adsorption, dissociation and diffusion dominate the oxygen evolution reaction on the electrodes.
Titulo: Performance and stability of Ruddlesden-Popper La2NiO4+δ oxygen electrodes under solid oxide electrolysis cell operation conditions

Sentencas: Electrical conductivity relaxation (ECR) measurements imply that LNO shows better oxygen surface exchange performance than conventional LSM and LSCF electrodes, because of its special crystal structure with flexible non-stoichiometric oxygen.
Titulo: Performance and stability of Ruddlesden-Popper La2NiO4+δ oxygen electrodes under solid oxide electrolysis cell operation conditions

Sentencas: Significant performance degradation was observed during polarization at 500 mA cm(-2) and 750 degrees C in the SOEC mode for 48 h. XRD and XPS results confirmed that high-order Ruddlesden-Popper La3Ni2O7 and La4Ni3O10 phases have great contributions to the performance degradation of LNO oxygen electrodes related to anodic current polarization at 500 mA cm(-2) and 750 degrees C.
Titulo: Performance and stability of Ruddlesden-Popper La2NiO4+δ oxygen electrodes under solid oxide electrolysis cell operation conditions
